title: Prayer for Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 28 is a heartfelt prayer of David calling upon the Lord for help and protection against the wicked. It expresses trust in God’s strength and justice, culminating in praise for His saving power and a plea for His continued blessing on His people.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of the Psalm, a king of Israel who earnestly seeks God's help and protection.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Opponents who act deceitfully and oppose God's people, representing those who reject God's works.

definitions.definition: A metaphor for God’s strength, stability, and protection.
Earnest prayers or requests made humbly to God.
The sacred place where God’s presence dwells, often referring to the temple or sanctuary.
One chosen and consecrated by God, often referring to the king or Messiah.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for God’s Attention and Protection
outline.description: David urgently calls on God not to be silent but to hear his cries and prayers, lifting his hands toward God’s holy dwelling as a sign of earnest supplication.

outline.heading: Request for Justice Against the Wicked
outline.description: David asks God not to let him be counted among the wicked who deceive others, but to repay the wicked according to their deeds, emphasizing God’s righteous judgment.

outline.heading: Praise for God’s Deliverance and Strength
outline.description: David blesses the Lord for hearing his prayers, acknowledging God as his strength and shield, which causes his heart to rejoice and praise God with song.

outline.heading: Declaration of God’s Strength for His People
outline.description: The Psalm concludes with a declaration that God is the strength of His anointed and a prayer for the salvation, blessing, and continual care of His people.

application: Approach God boldly in prayer, trusting that He hears and responds to sincere supplications.
Trust God’s justice to deal with the wicked rather than taking matters into your own hands.
Rejoice and praise God for His protection and strength in times of trouble.
Pray continually for God’s blessing and provision over His people and His church.

keyVerses.text: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusted in him, and I am helped: therefore my heart greatly rejoiceth; and with my song will I praise him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the believer’s trust in God as a source of strength and protection, leading to joyful praise.

keyVerses.text: Blessed be the LORD, because he hath heard the voice of my supplications.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes God’s faithfulness in hearing and answering prayer.

keyVerses.text: Give them according to their deeds, and according to the wickedness of their endeavours: give them after the work of their hands; render to them their desert.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God’s righteous judgment and justice toward the wicked.
